subject: Re: black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... list up ... to test ... case is ... used. ... That is ... Can you please explain why it would be a bad idea to use JUnit in the above example and how
messageBody:
> > For example, for some index class, if you know it uses a linear
list up
> > to 5 items and then a hash table, choosing to test with 4 items
to test
> > the list case and also test with 5 items to test the hash table
case is
> > white box testing.
>
> Yes. That is an example of whitebox testing.
>
> [...]
>
> Different tools for different fools:
>
> JUnit is designed for blackbox testing. That is how it should be
used.
> The new JDK 1.4 assertion facilities are for whitebox testing.
That is
> how they should be used.

Can you please explain why it would be a bad idea to use JUnit in the
above example and how assertions would be the more appropriate tool?

Thanx, Ilja
